attributes.action: changes to UK spouse Visa, so Its easier for people of the UK to marry abroad
attributes.additional_details:
After getting married abroad, coming back to UK and finding a job which pays enough per year to sponsor a spouse is hard

After getting a job waiting for 7 calendar months payslips is hard staying here because your spouse is abroad

Finally £3600 savings for 6 months, someone on a £8.30 an hour job, is very hard after paying rent, commuting and food expenses.

The government doesn't care how many marriages are broken, marrying a girl or boy from outside UK is always a big regret NEEDS CHANGE
attributes.background:
The current Non EU spouse Visa requires the UK partner to submit 7 calendar month payslips, 6 month bank statements which has at-least £3600 savings if he or she earns £18K per year.
For an average UK citizen who lives and works in London earning just above the national minimum wage is very hard

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly how you would like the rules on spousal visas to change.

You'll need to give your full name to start a petition.
